keyTakeAways: Masked thieves robbed the Louvre Museum in Paris on Sunday morning, breaking in through a window in the Apollo Gallery.
The suspects used small chainsaws and box cutters to smash display cases housing valuable Napoleonic-era jewels.
The robbers fled on Yamaha TMax scooters toward a nearby highway, indicating a planned and coordinated escape.
One of the stolen jewels was reportedly found abandoned near the museum, suggesting a possible misstep during the escape.
The museum described the stolen items as 'priceless' and of 'inestimable cultural and historical value'.
French officials, including Culture Minister Rachida Dati and Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez, described the heist as a 'major, highly organized operation' lasting just seven minutes.
The suspects were estimated to number three to four and were described as 'very experienced', using a lift platform on a truck to reach the window.
All central police units in Paris have been mobilized, and the museum remains closed to preserve evidence.
The Apollo Gallery, a key display space for royal jewels, reopened in 2020 after renovations and is one of the Louvre's most iconic areas.

summaryOfNewsArticle: On Sunday, October 19, 2025, masked thieves broke into the Louvre Museum in Paris, using a lift platform on a truck to access a window in the Apollo Gallery, where they smashed display cases with chainsaws and box cutters to steal jewels from the Napoleonic collection. The suspects fled on Yamaha TMax scooters, and one of the stolen items was later found abandoned near the museum. French officials, including Culture Minister Rachida Dati and Interior Minister Laurent Nuñez, described the heist as a highly organized and rapid operation lasting just seven minutes, involving three to four experienced individuals. The museum remains closed to preserve evidence, and all central Paris police units are mobilized in the investigation. The Apollo Gallery, known for housing royal jewels, is a central focus of the cultural and historical significance of the incident.
title: Masked Thieves Steal 'Priceless' Jewels from the Louvre Museum
